column1: One morning a little rabbit sat on a bank.He pricked his ears and listened to the trit-trot
column2: trit-trot of a pony.A gig was coming along the road; it was driven by Mr. McGregor
column3: and beside him sat Mrs. McGregor in her best bonnet.As soon as they had passed
column4: little Benjamin Bunny slid down into the road

column12: and Peter.Old Mrs. Rabbit was a widow; she earned her living by knitting rabbit-wool mittens and muffatees (I once bought a pair at a bazaar). She also sold herbs
column14: and rabbit-tobacco (which is what we call lavender).Little Benjamin did not very much want to see his Aunt.He came round the back of the fir-tree
column15: and nearly tumbled upon the top of his Cousin Peter.Peter was sitting by himself. He looked poorly
column16: and was dressed in a red cotton pocket-handkerchief.
